com.habelitz.jsobjectizer.jsom.api
Interface VariableInitializer

All Superinterfaces:
JSOM
public interface VariableInitializer
extends JSOM

This JSOM type represents a variable initializer.

A variable initializer can exist in two different incarnations. The first variant is a more or less simple expression that can be most trivially any literal or even a fairly complex expression. The second variant are array initializers like the following formal example 

     {   {"11", "12", "13"},
         {"21", "22", "23"},
         {"31", "32", "33"},
     }
The first variant can be resolved simply by calling the method getExpression() that returns the initializer expression. Resolving an array initializer is a little bit more complex and it starts with calling the method getArrayInitializers() which returns a list of VariableInitializer objects that can represent expressions or further array initializers.

Taking the array initializer example above the first call of getArrayInitializers() would return a list containing three VariableInitializer objects representing array initializers again. Repeating the getArrayInitializers() call on each of these three objects will result in getting three further lists of three VariableInitializer objects each, which now represent variable initializer expressions. Finally the method getExpression() can be called on each of these nine objects.

Author:
Dieter Habelitz

Method Detail

getArrayInitializers

java.util.List<VariableInitializer> getArrayInitializers()
If this represents an array initializer this method returns a list of the array initializers (see the documentation of this class above).

Calling this method equals an getArrayInitializers(null) call.

Returns:
A list of the array initializers. If this doesn't represent an array initializer or if this represents an empty array initializer (i.e. isArrayInitializer() will return false for the first case but true for the second case) null will be returned.
See Also:
getArrayInitializers(List)

getArrayInitializers

java.util.List<VariableInitializer> getArrayInitializers(java.util.List<VariableInitializer> pList)
If this represents an array initializer this method returns a list of the array initializers (see the documentation of this class above).

Parameters:
pList - If this argument isn't null the array initializers will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of the array initializers. If this doesn't represent an array initializer or if this represents an empty array initializer (i.e. isArrayInitializer() will return false for the first case but true for the second case) null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

getExpression

Expression getExpression()
Returns the initializer expression.

Returns:
The initializer expression or null if this represents an array initializer.

isArrayInitializer

boolean isArrayInitializer()
Returns true if this represents an array initializer.

Returns:
true if this represents an array initializer.
